. Google earned$ 8.75 a share, beating analysts expectations of$ 8.06 a share. "Q4 marked a terrific end to a stellar year," said Eric Schmidt , CEO of Google. Our strong performance has been driven by a rapidly growing digital economy, continuous product innovation that benefits both users and advertisers, and by the extraordinary momentum of our newer businesses, such as display and mobile. These results give us the optimism and confidence to invest heavily in future growth-- investments that will benefit our users, Google and the wider web. The big news from the earnings report was the announcement that Eric Schmidt will step down from his role of CEO and become Executive Chairman, focusing externally on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships,
